meanings.definition: A warning or indication of a future event.
meanings.sent1: She had a feeling of premonitions before the storm hit.
meanings.sent2: The sudden drop in temperature was a premonition of the coming snowstorm.
meanings.sent3: Her premonitions about the test being canceled turned out to be true.
meanings.sent4: The dark clouds gathering in the sky were a premonition of the impending thunderstorm.
meanings.sent5: His premonitions of danger always proved to be accurate.

meanings.definition: To warn or forewarn in advance.
meanings.sent1: The old man tried to premonition the villagers about the approaching danger.
meanings.sent2: It is important to premonition others about potential risks.
meanings.sent3: She premonitioned her friends about the surprise party to avoid spoiling the secret.
meanings.sent4: The teacher premonitioned the students about the upcoming pop quiz.
meanings.sent5: The dog barking loudly premonitioned us of the intruder's presence.
